availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert C. Steen (Lykins, Kansas, farmer, QM serg. and lieut. 1st Ky Ind Batter)

body.p: Lykins County, Kansas territory, farmer and soldier. Native of Canada. Son of James S. Steen. Married to Maggie Latimer Steen in Gallia, Ohio, on April 26, 1862. Farmer in Lykins County in 1860. Served in the 2nd Ohio Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private from April 17, 1861, to August 1861. Served in the 1st Kentucky Independent Battery (U.S.A.) as quartermaster sergeant and lieutenant from January 10, 1862, to September 5, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kansas, Lykins County, Richland Township, p. 176.
Ohio, U.S., County Marriage Records, 1774-1993, Various Ohio County Courthouses, Gallia County Marriages, Film #000317652, p. 453.
Kansas, U.S., Cemetery Records, 1812-1981, Kansas State Historical Society, Topeka, Kansas, Various County Cemeteries, p. 180 of 323 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Historical Register of National Homes for Disabled Volunteer Soldiers, 1866-1938, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series M1749, Milwaukee, p. 130 of 3793 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0152.
Find A Grave, "Robert Steen (1842-1930)," Memorial #33303413, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/33303413 (accessed February 19, 2021).
